iati-activity.title: Integrated watershed management project in Sudan
iati-activity.description: The Watershed Management Project in Sudan has emerged form the Nile Basin Initiative and is linked Eastern Nile Subsidiary Action Project. The complementarity aims of the project are to lift the communities out of the poverty trap they are in by raising their productivity whilst promoting sustainable use of the landscape and natural resources. This in turn is expected to lead to reduced erosion to the benefit of downstream users.

location.name: Atbara, Bau and Dinder national parks

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Fida Int.)
iati-activity.description: Community Development Project in Greater Khartoum. The aim of the project is to improve and develop the capacity of the local partner to carry out holistic community development work.Fidaâs partner is Sudan Pentecostal Church which has approximately 20 local churches in the poor suburbs of Greater Khartoum. The church members are eager to help their communities but they need training and tools for it. The project trains community development trainers_ who train volunteers_ who work as advisors and support persons in their communities. The project focuses on two major components: Community Development Education (CDE) and HIV/AIDS.Through the project_ the partner is equipped with growing know-how and skills within sustainable development work. This will contribute to the increasing impact of the partnerâs work in community level.

iati-activity.title: Project on Landscape Management Planning and Training for the Environm
iati-activity.description: The main objective of the project is to combat desertification by strenghtening the capacities of Southern Sudanese forest administration and local communities. The project is an inception phase during which a project document for implementation phase is produced.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Sudan
iati-activity.description: The project will provide a chance to train and change the attitudes of 20 traditional midwives, on anti-FGM and also HIV/AIDS. Campaigns against FGM practice & open dialogue will be condcuted (10 forums in 10 selected rural areas) that address the issue of FGM & raise awareness of women ,youth, religious groups about negative health consequences of FGM on girls & confiscate child rights & make a pledge to stop this harmful practice in rural villages.

iati-activity.title: Facilitating Inter-ethnic statebuilding dialogue for building conf
iati-activity.description: CMIs project in Southern Sudan targets peaceful state-building by including traditional tribal leaders to create a joint effort with the Southern Sudanese government. The multiethnic people of Southern Sudan is prone to inner conflicts. The project begins with mapping problematic issues and possible solutions through interviews with the tribal representatives. Then the dialogue continues in small groups consisting of tribal leaders. The goal is to build mutual trust among the tribes and discuss the critical issues regarding the future of Southern Sudan. Then two workshops are held between all the tribal leaders in order to agree on a common agenda for the future development of the country. Finally, the results are disseminated in a national seminar, which will be attnded by the government representatives and other actors.
